name: Simply Vietnam
summary: With its long history, interesting culture, and gorgeous scenery, Vietnam offers something for everyone. On this Vietnam tour, you’ll overnight in Hanoi, Ha Long Bay, Phong Nha National Park, Hoi An, Hue, and Ho Chi Minh City. Sightseeing tours in the cities feature the must-see historic sites, including Hanoi’s Temple of Literature, built in 1070, and One Pillar Pagoda, built in 1049; Hoi An’s Japanese Covered Bridge; Hue’s Forbidden Purple City, the emperor’s residence constructed in 1804; and Hoi An’s Thien Mu Pagoda. In Ho Chi Minh City, your sightseeing includes the War Remnants Museum and the Cu Chi region, where you'll have a chance to enter and explore the deep, narrow tunnels constructed by the Viet Cong during the war.You'll enjoy seeing some of Vietnam's most gorgeous sights and destinations via the water. Cruise on Ha Long Bay, a UNESCO World Heritage Site with some of the world's most amazing limestone scenery. You'll sail by islets, caves, beaches, and floating villages. In Phong Nha National Park, a boat ride on the Son River takes you to Phong Nha Cave. You'll also enjoy a cruise in Hoi An on the Thu Bon River, where you'll pass unspoiled countryside. These are just some of the many highlights on this tour through Vietnam. From the historic sites to the gorgeous scenery, this Vietnam tour designed for savvy, value-minded travelers is a vacation of a lifetime!

timeline.title: Day 1: HANOI, VIETNAM
timeline.description: Welcome to Vietnam’s capital city. Hotel rooms are available for a mid-afternoon check-in.

timeline.title: Day 2: HANOI
timeline.description: Today’s included sightseeing tour takes you to many of the city’s highlights, including the TEMPLE OF LITERATURE, a peaceful series of walled courtyards and gateways, and ONE PILLAR PAGODA, designed to resemble a lotus blossom. You will also see Ho Chi Minh’s stilt house, Hoan Kiem Lake, and the fascinating network of alleyways and shop houses that make up the Old Quarter. This evening, enjoy a performance of Hanoi’s famed WATER PUPPETS. (B,D)

timeline.title: Day 3: HANOI-HA LONG BAY
timeline.description: Drive to Ha Long Bay, one of Vietnam’s favorite destinations, and board your DAY CRUISE through the stunning bay. Enjoy lunch on board as you sail through the dramatic limestone islands, then explore the Sung Sot (Surprising Cave) and visit Titov Island. (B,L)

timeline.title: Day 4: HA LONG BAY–HANOI–PHONG NHA-KE BANG NATIONAL PARK
timeline.description: Return to Hanoi this morning and fly to Dong Hoi. From here, journey inland to remarkable PHONG NHA-KE BANG NATIONAL PARK, a UNESCO park littered with beautiful jungles, caves, and underground rivers. Your lodging tonight is a charming farmstay at the base of park. (B,D)

timeline.title: Day 5: PHONG NHA-KE BANG NATIONAL PARK
timeline.description: This morning, take a BOAT RIDE on the Son River to PHONG NHA CAVE, famous for its rock formations with names like the “Lion” and the “Buddha.” The afternoon is at your leisure to enjoy the activities and serene views at your hotel. (B,L,D)

timeline.title: Day 6: PHONG NHA-KE BANG NATIONAL PARK–HUE
timeline.description: Drive to Hue, stopping at the DMZ bridge en route. Upon arrival in the imperial walled city of Hue, visit the FORBIDDEN PURPLE CITY, modeled after Beijing’s famed Forbidden CIty. During your visit, you will see Thai Hoa Palace, the Halls of the Mandarins, and the Nine Dynastic Urns. (B)

timeline.title: Day 7: HUE–HOI AN
timeline.description: Begin today with a visit to pretty THIEN MU PAGODA, made up of seven tiers, each dedicated to a step assumed by Buddha to reach enlightenment. Continue up the river to the IMPERIAL TOMB OF MINH MANG, a majestic complex of courtyards, pavilions, and temples in a beautiful setting. Head south through spectacular Hai Van Pass (weather permitting) and visit the CHAM MUSEUM, then continue to the charming town of Hoi An. (B,L)

timeline.title: Day 8: HOI AN
timeline.description: Start today with a CRUISE on the Thu Bon River, passing unspoiled countryside. Then, a leisurely WALKING TOUR through Hoi An Ancient Town brings you to the Japanese Covered Bridge. The remainder of the day is at your leisure. (B)

timeline.title: Day 9: HOI AN–HO CHI MINH CITY
timeline.description: Enjoy your morning at leisure. This afternoon, fly to Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam’s largest and most vibrant city, packed with timeless traditions. (B)

timeline.title: Day 10: HO CHI MINH CITY
timeline.description: Today’s sightseeing tour takes in Dong Khoi Street, the main shopping thoroughfare, Notre Dame Cathedral, and the Central Post Office. Afterward, visit the REUNIFICATION PALACE and the WAR REMNANTS MUSEUM, as well as the Chinese district. (B)

timeline.title: Day 11: HO CHI MINH CITY. CU CHI TUNNELS EXCURSION
timeline.description: Today, visit the CU CHI TUNNELS, an extraordinary network of tunnels more than 120 miles long that was used by the Viet Cong as a hideout and secret village during the war. See secret trapdoors, underground kitchens, living areas, and meeting rooms. If you are feeling adventurous, you may enter and explore the deep, narrow tunnels. (B)

timeline.title: Day 12: HO CHI MINH
timeline.description: Your tour ends with breakfast this morning. (B)

name: 9 Days Essential Vietnam trip from South to North, Max 6 Guests
summary:
Features:
•Mini Group size of 2-6 travelers 
•Guaranteed departure tour

Highlights:
Our 9 day Essential Vietnam trip includes almost all important cities of Vietnam. Departs from Ho Chi Minh City in the south, there are a large number of French-style buildings, full of French style, followed by the Mekong Delta to experience the local flavor. Then you will come to the cities of central Vietnam - Hoi An and Hue. There are two World Heritage Sites that can not be missed. One is the Hue Ancient Buildings and the other is the Hoi An Ancient City. Finally, we will come to the quiet capital city Hanoi and indulge in the beautiful natural scenery of Halong Bay by a relaxing cruise trip.

timeline.title: Day 01: Arrival in Ho Chi Minh City
timeline.description:
Welcome to Vietnam's financial hub: Saigon (Ho Chi Minh City). Upon arrival, our guide and driver will pick you up from the airport and transfer you to the hotel. Enjoy the rest of the day at your leisure to recover from jet lag and explore the city on your own. 
Accommodation: Liberty Central Saigon Riverside Hotel (4 stars) or similar

timeline.title: Day 02: Ho Chi Minh City
timeline.description:
After breakfast, let's start the day tour with Ho Chi Minh City's China Town - Cholon, where you will visit some of the Temples dedicated to the worship of Tin Hau, Avalokitesvara, Buddha or Taoism. Later, we will enjoy the first Museum of Traditional Vietnamese Medicine (FITO). After lunch, we visit the War Remnants Museum and former Presidential Palace. As a conclusion of the day, you will have time to visit some French colonial architecture such as the Notre Dame Cathedral and the Old Post Office. 
Meals: Breakfast, Lunch
Accommodation: Liberty Central Saigon Riverside Hotel (4 stars) or similar

timeline.title: Day 03: Ho Chi Minh City - Ben Tre - Ho Chi Minh City
timeline.description:
Today you will spend a day away from the busy city and drive 90km (2hrs) to Ben Tre. Board on your private boat to enjoy the delta scenery along the Ham Luong river. Experience the unique lifestyle of the Mekong Delta as you visit fruit orchards, coconut groves, brick workshops etc. The boat will then stop at a quiet village, you can have a short walk to visit a local family to learn how they make sedge mat and enjoy tea, tropical fruits, take “Xe Loi”, a kind of motorized rickshaw or you can hop onto your bicycle and peddle through picturesque villages. Stop at a riverside restaurant for a delicious and filling lunch. Then board a sampan for a relaxing trip along narrow canals. The boat will be waiting for you at the pier nearby to bring you back to Ben Tre where your car will take you to Saigon.  
Meals: Breakfast, Lunch
Accommodation: Liberty Central Saigon Riverside Hotel (4 stars) or similar

timeline.title: Day 04: Ho Chi Minh City - Danang - Hoi An
timeline.description:
We will see you off to take a flight to Danang and our local guide will transfer you to the ancient town Hoian. We will have a half-day walking tour through the winding streets with some stopovers at attractions including Chua Ong Pagoda, the Chinese Assembly Hall, the 200-year old Tam Ky ancestral house and the famous Japanese Bridge. Finally,you will have a short relaxing experience on the river by boat to conclude today's tour.  
Meal: Breakfast
Accommodation: The Beach – Little Boutique Hoian (4 stars) or similar

timeline.title: Day 05: Hoi An - Danang - Hue
timeline.description:
This morning we will drive you to Hue by a private car. You will gothrough Hai Van pass, have a drink at the beautiful Lang Co Beach before continuing on to Hue. We will have an afternoon walk around the town and visit some attractions including the Imperial City (The Citadel), Hue Royal Palace, and the Mausoleum of Tu Duc. 
Meal: Breakfast
Accommodation: Moonlight Hotel (4 stars) or similar

timeline.title: Day 06: Hue - Hanoi
timeline.description:
This morning, you will have a private boat cruise down the river to visit Thien Mu Pagoda. Later spend some time at the busy Dong Ba Market and the ornate Minh Mang's tomb before boarding the flight to Hanoi. Upon arrival, your guide will meet you at the airport and transfer you to check in at the hotel. 
Meal: Breakfast
Accommodation: Hanoi La Siesta Hotel & Spa (4 stars) or similar

timeline.title: Day 07: Hanoi
timeline.description:
Today you will have a full day to explore this ancient and charming city thoroughly. First, we will arrive at Ba Dinh Square area, from which you will visit the nearby attractions to Ho Chi Minh's Mausoleum (closed on Mondays, Fridays, evenings & annual maintenance during Sept – Nov) and the stilt house, One Pillar Pagoda, the Presidential Palace. Then we go to the West Lake area, pay a short visit to the sedate Tran Quoc Pagoda & Quan Thanh Temple by the lake. In the afternoon, visit the Temple of Literature and the History Museum or the Ethnology Museum. The tour today ends by enjoying a special Water Puppet Performance at Hoan Kiem Lake area. 
Meal: Breakfast
Accommodation: Hanoi La Siesta Hotel & Spa (4 stars) or similar

timeline.title: Day 08: Hanoi - Halong Bay
timeline.description:
Your guide and driver will meet you at the lobby of your hotel and then set out on around 3-3.5 hours drive to the UNESCO World Heritage Site: Halong Bay. Board the cruise at around noon and have lunch onboard while sailing out into the mysterious bay. You will take an excursion to one limestone cave to view a great many stalactites and stalagmites. Stay overnight on the cruise.
Meals: Breakfast, Lunch & Dinner
Accommodation: Signature Cruise (4 stars) or similar

timeline.title: Day 09: Halong Bay - Hanoi - Departure
timeline.description:
You may find it interesting to participate in Tai Chi on the top deck. After a morning cup of coffee or tea, take a rowboat to explore some of the nearby islands. Then back to the junk for brunch. Upon your arrival at the dock, your guide and driver will meet you and transfer you to Noi Bai International Airport for your departure flight home. Your memorable Vietnam travel ends here.

Meals: Brunch

Highlights :

 	Take Cycle Tour.
 	Visit Ha Long Bay.

timeline.title: HA NOI ARRIVAL (-/-/-)
timeline.description:
You will be met by Luco Travel’s tour guide and driver at Noi Bai International Airport and transfer to Hanoi’s Old Quarter. Check in hotel. Free & Easy, or you may like this option as below:
                        Option : “ Xich Lo ” – Cycle Tour & Water Puppet Show.
Pick up at the hotel by “ Xich Lo”, driver you around Ha Noi’s Old Quarter, Hoan Kiem Lake, Ngọc Sơn Temple an hour and drop off you at the Ha Noi Water Puppet Show.
We will watch the Water Puppet Show. Traditional content of water puppet performance contains daily life of Vietnamese farmers (cultivating, tending buffalo, catching fishes…), communal entertainment (swimming contest, dragon dancing…), and/or historical legends (Le Loi returns precious sword…), with a performance that has appealed to audiences for centuries. Back to hotel.
Overnight in Ha Noi, arranged by Luco Travel – Vietnam Tour Operator.

timeline.title: HA NOI - HA LONG BAY - BAI TU LONG BAY (B/L/D)
timeline.description:
07:30. Breakfast at hotel and check out.
08:00. After that our bus will pick you up at your hotel and depart to Ha Long Bay. Ha Long Bay is located in Northern Vietnam and is one of the country’s most popular tourist attractions. Aside from being popular with tourists, it is also a culturally recognized UNESCO World Heritage Site. The bay is well known for its scenic karst topography, which is a subject of many popular photos of Vietnam.
The term “Ha Long Bay” literally translates to “Bay of Descending Dragons”. However, it was not until the 19th century that this name was officially designated. It was known in ancient times as simply Luc Thuy or An Bang. This natural heritage site was inscribed into the UNESCO World Heritage Sites in Vietnam list in 1994; there were extensions to the site that were added in 2000.
On the way to Ha Long Bay, we will have a short break of about 20 minutes. The car will arrive at Bai Chay, Hon Gai Harbor.
12:00. Pick-up at Hon Gai harbor. Transfer to Tonkin Cruise Boat by tender (5 -10 minutes)

13:30 Cruise through Bai Tu Long Bay & enjoy lunch aboard with a set menu.
15:30 Explore VungVieng Fishing Village: Guests may choose to discover the daily life of the fisherman communities by bamboo boat or kayak around Vung Vieng area. ( both options lasting about one hour )
17:30	Relax and enjoy the sunset while the boat is cruising to Cong Dong-Cong Do area to anchor overnight.
18:00	Free time or take part in the cooking class: learn how to cook traditional Vietnamese cuisines. ( Cooking class can be arranged upon request  )
19:30. Enjoy delicious BBQ dinner 
21:00	Free evening to join some activities like board games, squid fishing, or karaoke ( upon request)
Overnight on Cruise, arranged by Luco Travel – Vietnam Tour Operator.

07:10. Have breakfast on cruise.

08:30	Return to the boat, relax on the sundeck or watch fruit carving demonstration

10:30    Enjoy the last scenery of the Ha Long Bay over lunch when the boat cruises back to shore.
11:30:   After lunch, you will board our tender and head back to the wharf where you will be met by your return trip vehicle to transfer you to Hanoi.
17:00 Arrive in Ha Noi, check in and relax. 
Free & Easy
Overnight in Ha Noi, arranged by Luco Travel – Vietnam Tour Operator.

timeline.title: HA NOI CITY TOUR - DEPARTURE.(B/-/-)
timeline.description:
Today is departure day. Breakfast at the hotel, check out, you will visit the memorial complex for the historic figure and father of modern Vietnam - Ho Chi Minh, You will visit the Presidential palace, Uncle Ho's house on stilts, One Pillar Pagoda, and the Temple of Literature - Vietnam's first university that built in 1076, You will also - the picturesque West Lake and the sixth century Tran Quoc Buddhist Pagoda. 
Later, you will enjoy lunch at a local restaurant with special Vietnamese food. You’ll then proceed to check in at the hotel.
Afternoon:  You will visit the fascinating Vietnam Museum of Ethnology - which is both a research centre and a public museum exhibiting the ethnic groups of Vietnam. The mission of the museum is scientific research, collection, documentation, conservation, exhibition and preservation of the cultural and historic patrimony of the nation’s different ethnic groups. The museum also serves to guide research, conservation, and technology that are specific to the work of an ethnographic museum. 
You will also visit Hoan Kiem Lake with Ngoc Son Temple where a legendary turtle is reserved, and Hanoi’s Old Quarter, also known as the ‘36 streets’ with plenty of photo opportunities all around you. 
Enjoy some free time for last minute purchases on Dong Xuan Market before your transfer to the airport for your onward flight . Then, home sweet home.

timeline.title: Day 12: Ho Chi Minh City & Cu Chi Tunnels (B/L)
timeline.description:
AM: HCM City
We start the trip by visiting Notre Dame Cathedral, the historic Central Post Office, followed by exploring the Reunification Palace, and the remarkable site of the War Remnants Museum, (optional Ben Thanh Market - only drop off).
PM: Cu Chi Tunnels
Located 60km from HCMC, Cu Chi is now a popular spot for both Vietnamese & foreign tourists - the network of over 200km of tunnels became legendary when they played a vital role in the War. In their heyday, the tunnels were functioning underground cities including numerous trap doors, specially constructed living areas, storage facilities, weapons factories, field hospitals, command centers & kitchens.
Today, ducks and water buffalos happily co-exist in the rivers along the side of the road. However, the peaceful rural rice paddy scenery belies the area’s violent history. Visitors will find it hard to imagine the destruction, damage & defoliation over this whole area, caused by bombing and mines. There is plenty of evidence of the fierce battle that took place here during the 1960s when Cu Chi was a "Free Target Zone".
Start our tour in the morning, before entering the tunnels visitors can watch a short introductory video showing how the tunnels were constructed. You will spend the next hour exploring the tunnels. Afterwards, enjoy tea, cassava (guerrilla’s food during the war). Return to Sai Gon. Discovery Saigon at night by yourself. Overnight in Saigon.

timeline.description: Leaving Ho Chi Minh city, enjoy the scenic journey along the National Highway bordered by green rice fields. On arrival at My Tho, visit Vinh Trang pagoda, take a leisurely boat ride along the river, view stilt houses, fruit plantations and fishing villages along the river bank. Proceed to Tortoise islet, have lunch in the orchard garden. Then a boat ride to An Khanh – a less touristy attraction in Ben Tre, enjoy cruising on a hand-rowed sampan under the shade of the water coconut trees along natural canals, then enjoy seasonal fruit & honey tea to the sound of "Southern Vietnamese folk music", performed by the locals. Visit a family business which epitomizes the idyllic rural lifestyle, taste delicious coconut candy & observe the pastoral life as you roam through fruit plantations and villages.  Proceed to Can Tho. Overnight in the hotel.

timeline.description:
Take a leisurely boat trip to explore the picturesque tributaries of the Lower Mekong river ( Bassac River), then proceed to visit Cai Răng floating market (& Phong Dien is optional), which are the liveliest in the whole religion.
Have you ever tasted Vietnamese vermicelli soup? Well, now go and see how it is made. Then wander around the village and meet the friendly local people and experience how to cross a "Monkey bridge" which is built by only o¬ne stem of bamboo. Visit the orchard garden. Stop for lunch. Back to HCM city. Overnight in Sai Gon.

name: The Most Amazing Vietnam 13days/12nights
summary:
Highlights of trip:

  Visit some of the most popular sites in Vietnam
  Visit to Cu Chi Tunnels to explore the biggest defensive underground system in the Vietnam War period
  Luxury junk cruise on the legendary Ha Long Bay.Discovery the poetic city Hue & the ancient town Hoi An.
  Experience the heart of the Mekong delta with its scenic floating markets. In this semi-aquatic world, you discover how life really is in around this majestic river.
  Relaxing in Nha Trang Beach

timeline.title: Day 1: Saigon Arrival ( No Meal )
timeline.description:
The first time in the most bustling city of Vietnam.


Arrival at Tan Son Nhat Airport. Our guide pick up you here and proceed to hotel for checking-in.


Overnight at the hotel in Ho Chi Minh City.

timeline.title: Day 2: Cuchi Tunnel – Saigon City tour (B/L)
timeline.description:
Explore the boiling life-style of the biggest city in Vietnam
Breakfast at your hotel.
In the morning, we start visiting Saigon City: Reunification Palace, Notre Dame Cathedral, Saigon Post Office, Ben Thanh market.


After the lunch, you will go to Cu Chi Tunnels to explore the biggest defensive underground system in the Vietnam War period.  Upon arrival, before exploring the tunnels, you will have some short introduction followed by introductory video about how the tunnels were constructed and how the people survived in the harsh conditions of the war time. 


Then, spend your time to explore the remaining area and tunnel systems which included the special constructed living areas with kitchens, bedrooms side by side with other martial facilities like storage, weapons factories, field hospitals, and command centers helping whoever lives inside the tunnels meet their basic needs.


Overnight at the hotel in Saigon.

timeline.title: Day 3: Saigon – Mekong Delta (B/L)
timeline.description:
Mekong Delta – a rural but lively floating life.
Breakfast at your hotel – Follow the bus and tour guide to transfer to Cai Be.
Take a boat excursion to experience Cai Be floating market – one of the most colorful places on Mekong River.  


Upon arrival in Cai Be, have a boat ride to the remaining site of a very renowned wholesale floating market on Tien River many years ago. This site entitles you to know something about the local trading habit that has changed due to the age of modern society when more terrestrial transportation and high-technique of agriculture have dominated everywhere. There, you can realize how diverse the area is and how rich orchard gardens are, which makes it the basket of fruit in the lower part of the Mekong River.  


Ramble in small villages where you will uncover the beauty of Ba Kiet ancient house and get to know about the indigenous culture. Then we will paddle through small canals – an exciting experience since you can look around, unwind and soak up the wonderful atmosphere of the Upper Mekong Delta. Additionally, after arrival in Tan Phong Island, let yourself immerse in the tranquility of nature.


Get back to the dock by sampan and then take the bus back to Ho Chi Minh City. End the trip.
Overnight at the hotel in Saigon.

timeline.title: Day 4: Saigon – Nha Trang Beach (B) by plane
timeline.description:
Fly to Nha Trang – the city of beaches
Breakfast at your hotel – Move to the airport – Flight to Nha Trang city – Check in at the hotel near beach – Enjoy your leisure time.


Nha Trang is a center of beaches, islands, and interesting oceanic activities. For this reason, Nha Trang is always eventful with a lot of foreigners who want to enjoy the beautiful beaches. With free time here, you can explore around city with its famous sights as Ponour Tower, Dam market, Long Phuoc Pagoda, etc. Tasting some local foods or lying lazily in its private beaches are the ideal ways.


Overnight at the hotel in Nha Trang City.

timeline.title: Day 5: Nha Trang : Island & Beach ( B)
timeline.description:
A day of Islands & Beaches in Nha Trang, Khanh Hoa.
It is called “the city of beaches”, Nha Trang is amazing with swimming, snorkeling, or scuba diving. In the recent time, Nha Trang also serves “Walking under the sea tour”. Spend entire your day sauntering to anywhere you want to experience the oceanic programs. Overnight at the hotel in Nha Trang City.


You can refer this below itinerary for your day in Nha Trang: (Charge on request)
After breakfast, Nhat Long bus & tour guide take you to the pier to go to Mun Island. 
We start to visit Tri Nguyen Aquarium, then going to Tranh beach and Mun Marine Bank, and coming over a fishing Village named Con Se Tre.


At the end of day 5, we go back to Nha Trang City. Overnight at the hotel in Nha Trang City.

timeline.title: Nha Trang – Danang – Hoi An (B/D) by plane
timeline.description:
Welcome to Hoian - preserved ancient commercial port
Breakfast at your hotel – Move to Nha Trang Airport – Take a flight to Danang City.


After arriving, we will pick you up at the rendezvous. We get the tour started and go to visit Marble Mountains.
You will visit the Non Nuoc Village at the foot of Marble Mountains. The village is famous for its stone sculptures and handicrafts. Here you can admire many works of art made from stone and marble by the local artists.
If you want to challenge yourself physically, the Water Mount, one of the five mountains in the cluster, is a very good choice, with more than 150 steps for you to climb up. Here you can visit many natural caves such as Huyen Khong cave, Tang Chon cave, and Hoa Nghiem cave. Besides, there are also religious places, including the first Linh Ung pagoda in Da Nang, Tam Thai pagoda, and many other beautiful pagodas.


Saying good bye to Marble Mountains and the Non Nuoc village, we will go to Hoian ancient town. Upon Arriving Hoian, we will walk around this town, visit the ancient houses, ancient assembly hall, ancestral temple, and the symbol of Hoian, Japanese Bridge Pagoda. In Hoian, everything is preserved as they were hundreds years ago.


At night time, Hoian shows its beauty with colorful lanterns hung all around the town, and in the night market, where you can buy various kinds of souvenirs.
We will introduce to you the specialties of Hoian at dinner. After the meal, we will go back to your hotel in Hoi An

timeline.title: Tra Que Village- Hoi An (B/L)
timeline.description:
You will spend half-day discovering Tra Que Village.
Breakfast at the hotel.


Local guide will see you at your hotel with your bicycle. You will cycle to a local farm in Tra Que Village. A short stroll will take you around the vegetable garden and then you can join the farmers in preparing the land and fertilizing it with seaweed from the local lake. The following steps are raking the ground, sowing, watering, picking vegetable and many other gardening activities. After all these activities, you will take a short rest and enjoy foot bath before getting to preparing lunch with a local family. 


Your lunch will consist of many local delicacies including “Tam Huu” spring roll, “Banh Xeo” or local pancake of people in Vietnam middle region. You can join the cooking with the chef on these meals. After your morning excursions and your lunch, you will take a Vietnamese traditional post-prandial nap before learning how to harvest and wrap the vegetables.


Saying farewell to the host family and riding back to Hoi An. In the evening, you will have more time to take a stroll around Hoi An and enjoy its beauty, along with the luminous lanterns.
Overnight at Hoi An hotel.

timeline.title: Da Nang - Hue City Tour (B/L) - Hanoi by plane
timeline.description:
Breakfast at your hotel.
In the morning, you will be picked up at the rendezvous in Danang, then we start Hue city tour. On the way to Hue, you will pass through Hai Van Tunnel, the longest tunnel in Southeast Asia.


Besides that, you will have some time to enjoy the golden sandy beach of Lang Co Bay – one of the most beautiful bay in the planet.
After arriving Hue citadel, you will visit Khai Dinh Tomb – the combination of Asian and European cultural structure, embodying the beauty of this ancient city.


Thien Mu Pagoda – the most beautiful pagoda of Hue, which is considered as the National pagoda of The Nguyen Dynasty, is your next destination after Khai Dinh Tomb. You can find the relics of Monk Thich Quang Duc – his private car, an eloquent witness of the Buddhist era in Vietnam.
At lunch time, introduce to you Hue specialties – the featured local dishes of this ancient city, in one of Hue’s famous restaurants.


We will take you to Hue Imperial city – the former administrative center as well as the accommodation of 13 Kings of the Nguyen Dynasty – the last feudatory Empire of Vietnam. The Imperial city is preserved as new for hundreds years, and tourists are allowed to visit many places such as Meridian Gate, Thai Hoa Palace and Duyet Thi duong theatre. Our tour guide will tell you the secret stories of the Royal family, of the Kings and the Queens’ lives. Afterward, we will head to Da Nang International Airport.
Overnight at the hotel in Hanoi.

timeline.title: Hanoi City Tour (B/L)
timeline.description:
Having breakfast at the hotel.
We will pick you up at your hotel to visit Tran Quoc pagoda, Buddhist relics and national heritage which lies on the West Lake.


Visit Ho Chi Minh’s Mausoleum, the final resting place of Viet Nam’s greatest father; President Ho Chi Minh’s stilt house where he lived and worked from 1958 to 1969. and Ho Chi Minh Museum where tourists will learn much about his devotion for Viet Nam.


Just next door is Ho Chi Minh’s house on stilts and lying to one side of the Mausoleum is the One-Pillar Pagoda which was founded by King Ly Thai To in 1049 - the structure has become an important symbol for the people of Hanoi.


Visit Temple of Literature. Although several Temples of Literature can be found throughout Vietnam, the most prominent and famous is that situated in the city of Hanoi, which also functioned as Vietnam's first university. The temple was first constructed in 1070 under King Lý Nhân Tông and is dedicated to Confucius, sages and scholars. It is a vast structure that has existed to present day.


We will have lunch at a local restaurant.
We will explore the handicraft village of Bat Trang Potttery.


Drive back to legendary Hoan Kiem lake to visit Ngoc Son Temple which worships Van Xuong saint and Tran Hung Dao former general commander. We also observe the beautiful Vietnamese and French architecture around the lake. Then we will bring you back to your hotel.
Overnight at the hotel in Hanoi.

timeline.title: Hanoi – Hoa Lu - Tam Coc (B/L)
timeline.description:
Having breakfast at the hotel.
Tour guide and shutter bus will pick up you at the hotel in Ha Noi old quarter and Hanoi Opera House then departs to Ninh Binh province. On the halfway stop for a short break of 20 minutes.


Arrive at Hoa Lu, which is once depicted the ancient capital of Viet Nam, settled up in the 10th century. Visit temples of two dynasties of Dinh and Le with very unique architecture in the old time. After that visiting the excavation area beside the Le Dai Hanh temple. You experience the vestiges of Royal Palaces ground dated back 10th century. Then back to the bus and transfer to Tam Coc.


Have lunch buffet with Vietnamese traditional dishes, in case you are vegetarian, we have other food options for you.
In the afternoon
Board the sampan boats (2 people share a boat) in Tam Coc dock to drift down the river among the villages, mountains and lush rice fields. Passing through 3 caves "Hang Ca - First cave, Hang Hai - Second cave, Hang Ba - Third cave" to get a strange feeling.

Get on the bus back to Hanoi, on the half way stop for short break 20 minutes.


Arrive at the hotel in Ha Noi old quarter and Hanoi Opera House.
Dinner on your own.

name: Cycling Vietnam
summary:
We ride from vibrant Saigon in the south to the thrilling capital of Hanoi in 
the north on this two week cycling tour, travelling on tarmac roads through 
colourful fishing villages, folding rice terraces and mountains cloaked in 
jungle. The vast shoreline of white sandy beaches is ours to discover along 
the way, with time to swim in the sea on a tropical island retreat. Stopping 
off at the ancient trading port of Hoi An, home to temples and wooden 
merchant houses, we delve into the peacefulness of rural Vietnam before 
ascending the Hai Van Pass, riding along twisting coastal roads that lead to 
remarkable views of the misty forest below.

timeline.title: Day 1: Start Saigon
timeline.description:
Ho Chi Minh City (HCMC), formerly known as Saigon, is an exciting and 
absorbing city where bicycles battle with lorries and temples stand defiantly 
alongside modern developments. Devastated by the Vietnam War, Saigon is now a 
bustling free market city where anything goes. The Ben Thanh Market and Notre 
Dame Cathedral are within easy walking distance and are highly recommended.

This evening there will be a welcome briefing with you leader followed by an 
optional group dinner at a local restaurant.
*Huong sen Hotel or similar*

timeline.title: Day 2: Transfer out of the city; cycle to the Cu Chi tunnels
timeline.description:
This morning we drive out of the city, before riding to the Cu Chi Tunnels. 
This offers a great introduction to cycling in Vietnam and a chance to 
fine-tune the bikes. The tunnels were Viet Cong sanctuaries, used by the 
guerrillas as living quarters and escape routes. The network covers 3 levels 
and approximately 240km of tunnels. Some parts have been widened for 
tourists, but the tunnels were originally very narrow and it is still 
necessary to crawl on hands and knees. Claustrophobes may prefer to stay 
outside in the sunshine!

If you prefer not to visit the tunnels you can have an unguided free day in 
Saigon. Places of interest include: the Emperor of Jade and Giac Lam pagodas, 
the former Presidential Palace (now the Reunification Hall), Ben Thanh market 
and the War Remnants Museum. 
* Huong sen Hotel or similar*

timeline.title: Day 3: Cycle towards the coast and drive to Mui Ne
timeline.description:
After an early breakfast we head out of Saigon by bus and then start cycling 
towards the coast. We hit the backroads and head through tropical fruit and 
rubber plantations also passing some small fishing villages as we make our 
way closer to the coast finishing our ride in time for lunch. We then 
transfer approx. 3 hours to Mui Ne, a tranquil white sand beach where we can 
witness our first sunset over the Eastern Sea. We spend approx. 4-5 hours on 
the bus today. 

*Sea Links Beach Hotel or similar*

timeline.title: Day 4: Cycle to Dalat in the Central Highlands
timeline.description:
We cycle towards Dalat; the route is undulating with occasional climbs. Along 
the way we pass coffee and tea plantations as well as flower gardens and pine 
forests as we reach higher altitude. We rejoin the bus before the road climbs 
steeply to the mountain town of Dalat. We spend approx 3.5 hours on the bus 
today.

Dalat is a pleasant hill station, formerly known as Le Petit Paris, and has 
been described as the most beautiful town in Vietnam. It was favoured by the 
French for its climate, and is now a popular honeymoon resort for the 
Vietnamese. 
*La Sapinette Hotel or similar*

timeline.title: Day 5: Cycle through Bidoup N.P.; to the coast and boat transfer to Whale Island
timeline.description:
Today's ride is predominantly undulating and approximately 30km downhill 
through pine forests and paddy fields as we descend nearly 1,500m travelling 
through the Bidoup Ba National Park. This area is home to rare pine forests 
as well as small villages inhabited by the ethnic minority people of the 
central highlands. Once we arrive at the coast, we head by bus (approx. 1.5 
hours) to the coast near Nha Trang before boarding a boat to our tropical 
island retreat of Whale Island for the next two nights. Today you can cycle 
up to 90km according to preference.
*Whale Island Resort or similar*

timeline.title: Day 6: Cruise around islands with seafood lunch and snorkelling
timeline.description:
Having a rest from the bikes today we get the opportunity to really relax and 
unwind. We will join a boat trip in the morning for a spot of snorkelling and 
swimming in the turquoise sea before a seafood lunch is served. In the 
afternoon there is the option to visit a local fishing village, see the Whale 
temple or walk around the island to the viewpoint for a 360 degree view of 
the stunning mountainous coastline and the surrounding coves and white sand 
beaches.
*Whale Island Resort or similar*

timeline.title: Day 7: Coastal ride to Quy Nhon
timeline.description:
We set off early in the morning and first take a short transfer from Whale 
Island through Dai Lanh & Ca Pass before setting off on our bikes at Vung Ro 
Bay where we ride along the coast to Tuy Hoa and O Loan Lagoon to Chi Thanh. 
In Chi Thanh, we stop for lunch and a short rest before continuing to ride to 
La Hai where we complete 100km of cycling today, the longest ride of the 
trip. From La Hai, we then transfer 1 hour to our hotel in Quy Nhon. 

(Approx. 2 hours in the bus today).

*Seagull Quy Nhon Hotel or similar*

timeline.title: Day 8: Further coastal ride stopping en route at sand dunes; then transfer to Hoi An
timeline.description:
Leaving Quy Nhon we travel through a new economic zone over the Thi Nai 
Peninsula and Nhon Hoi Bridge, the longest sea bridge in Vietnam. Getting off 
our bikes we will visit a market, where its not unusual to be pulled aside 
for a photo as this part of the country does not see many western tourists. 
The coast line features secluded bays, sand dunes and beaches with colourful 
fishing boats bobbing on the Eastern Sea. We will cycle until we arrive at 
Phu Ly and then drive to Hoi An. If time permits, we will cycle the last 12km 
once we turn off Highway 1 into Hoi An.
Hoi An, the original European trading port in Vietnam dating back to the 
mid-sixteenth Century is now a living museum, with attractive wooden 
merchant's houses and pagoda-style temples with Chinese, Japanese, Vietnamese 
and European architectural influences. It is also a marvellous place to 
wander around and enjoy the thriving riverside market. We spend two nights in 
Hoi An which is also a fantastic place to buy local art or have some clothes 
tailor-made for you. Its best to bring a picture or a sample of what you want 
made. Approx. 6 hours in the bus today. Cycle approx. 50km.
*Hoian River Green Boutique or similar*

timeline.title: Day 9: Sightseeing in Hoi An; free afternoon
timeline.description:
This morning we take a guided walking tour of Hoi An to explore some of the 
structures of historical significance in the Old Town, including bridges, 
temples, wells and houses. Those less interested in architecture can cycle 
the 5km to the lovely Cua Dai beach or cycle to the Marble Mountains, which 
are 19km from town. These five marble hills, formerly islands, contain many 
caves, some of which were used as Buddhist (and Viet Cong) sanctuaries.

Also nearby is My Khe beach, a famous US R & R spot in the war, and Da Nang, 
where there is a Cham Museum, which despite being in poor condition, is very 
interesting. It is also possible to visit My Son, one of the most important 
Cham temple sites in Vietnam where Cham kings were buried as early as the 
fourth century. Although wartime bombing has destroyed much of the site, 
there are a number of interesting stone towers and sanctuaries.
*Hoian River Green Boutique or similar*

timeline.title: Day 10: Ride over the spectacular Hai Van Pass; cycle and drive on to Hue
timeline.description:
Today we turn north again for the drive/cycle to Hue. The route traverses 
over the spectacular Hai Van Pass - the 'Pass of the Ocean Clouds'. The views 
are stunning though those who prefer to avoid the 580m climb can always take 
a lift in the support vehicle. Once at the top it will all seem worth it as 
you plummet back to the ocean, then continue through small villages and 
timeless rural scenes to the outskirts of Hue, from where we transfer to our 
city centre hotel. Approx 2.5 hours in the bus today. Cycle approx. 80km.
*Park View Hotel or similar*

timeline.title: Day 11: Explore Hue and surroundings by bike and boat; overnight train to Hanoi
timeline.description:
Hue is often claimed to be the cultural and historic centre of Vietnam and 
there is plenty to see. We take a guided tour of the city and surrounding 
tombs. The most memorable site is the citadel, with walls six miles in 
length: inside are the palaces and halls of the Mandarins, and the remains of 
the Forbidden Purple City, where only the emperor and his eunuchs and 
concubines were allowed. We then take a boat along the Perfume River to the 
elaborate tombs of the Nguyen emperors, who ruled Vietnam from Hue. Tu Duc's 
Tomb is very elaborate and set in beautiful gardens. Along the way we will 
visit the famous Thien Mu Pagoda. The pagoda was a centre for anti-government 
protests in the early 1960s and it houses the Austin car that transported a 
monk, Thich Quang Duc, to Saigon in 1963 where he burned himself in protest 
against the president. The photograph of his self-immolation was printed in 
newspapers all around the world. In the afternoon we will board the 
Reunification Express for the overnight ride to Hanoi, 688km to the north. 
*Overnight Train*

timeline.title: Day 12: Arrive Hanoi; drive to Halong Bay; board boat and cruise/kayak among spectacular limestone formations
timeline.description:
We usually arrive in Hanoi in the early morning and stop for a local 
breakfast and a stretch of the legs, before we are met by our bus for an 
approximate 4 hour drive to Halong Bay. This is one of the most stunningly 
beautiful sights in South East Asia with around 3000 limestone peaks rising 
directly from the clear emerald sea. We cruise amongst this amazing karst 
scenery, stopping to kayak in the sea allowing us to get to places 
inaccessible by boat (weather permitting) and enjoy a seafood lunch on 
board. We overnight on board in twin share cabins with en suite facilities.
* Overnight Boat*

timeline.title: Day 13: Further cruising in Halong Bay; return to Hanoi
timeline.description:
Visit Me Cung cave and enjoy further time to cruise the many islands of 
Halong Bay. We then return to Hanoi late afternoon. This charming city 
contains many beautiful old buildings and the atmosphere is completely 
different from that in Saigon in the south, mainly due to the much more 
conservative nature of the North Vietnamese. Also, unlike its industrial 
counterpart, the centre of Hanoi has a faded charm with broad tree-lined 
avenues dating from the French period as well as some attractive lakes and 
pagodas. In the evening there is the option to enjoy a performance of Hanoi's 
famous water puppets.

*Lenid Hotel or similar*

timeline.title: Day 10: Ho Chi Minh City + Cu Chi Tunnels (Breakfast, Lunch)
timeline.description:
Morning: 08:00 am to noon time Start the trip for exploring the great atmosphere around of lively China town. Get into the rythm of this busiest and colourful scenes of Binh Tay market and Thien Hau Temple in the morning. We then visit the War Remnants Museum. Enjoy lunch at restaurant
PM: Cu Chi Tunnels
Located 60km from HCMC, Cu Chi is now a popular spot for both Vietnamese & foreign tourists - the network of over 200km of tunnels became legendary when they played a vital role in the War. In their heyday, the tunnels were functioning underground cities including numerous trap doors, specially constructed living areas, storage facilities, weapons factories, field hospitals, command centers & kitchens.
Today, ducks and water buffalos happily co-exist in the rivers along the side of the road. However, the peaceful rural rice paddy scenery belies the area’s violent history. Visitors will find it hard to imagine the destruction, damage & defoliation over this whole area, caused by bombing and mines. There is plenty of evidence of the fierce battle that took place here during the 1960s when Cu Chi was a "Free Target Zone". 

Start our tour in the morning, before entering the tunnels visitors can watch a short introductory video showing how the tunnels were constructed. You will spend the next hour exploring the tunnels. Afterwards, enjoy tea, cassava (guerrilla’s food during the war). Return to Sai Gon. 
Overnight in Sai Gon

timeline.title: Day 11: Ho Chi Minh City -Mekong Detal 1 day (Breakfast, Lunch)
timeline.description:
Breakfast at hotel. 
07.45: The tour guide pick up at the hotel. Enjoy the scenic journey along the National Highway bordered by green rice fields.  
On arrived at My Tho, visit Vinh Trang pagoda, take a leisurely boat ride along the river, view the stilt houses, fruit plantations and fishing villages along the river bank. Proceed to Tortoise islet, have lunch in the orchard garden. Then a boat ride to An Khanh – a less touristy attraction in Ben Tre, enjoy cruising on a hand-rowed sampan under the shadow of the water coconut trees along natural canals, then enjoy seasonal fruit & honey tea to the sound of "Southern Vietnamese folk music", performed by locals. 
Visit a family business which epitomizes the idyllic rural lifestyle, taste the delicious coconut candy & observe the pastoral life as you roam through the fruit plantation and village. Meet the bus and return to HCMC. This trip provides a fascinating insight into daily life in the Mekong Delta and you are guaranteed to take home your own private collection of beautiful memories.  
Overnight in Sai Gon.

A gourmet lunch is served in the restaurant while our cruise taking you on an odyssey journey wends among remote archipelagoes via crowd avoidance route and opens up views of one stupendous seascapes after another, passing uninhabited islets and outcrops including stone Thumb, Duck, Cock Fighting…

14h30:Our cruise will take you to HangLuon Cave. You can choose to get on a bamboo boat rowed by a local, gently glide through water tunnels into secluded sea lagoons or do kayak and explore the cave by yourself; while the others stay on boat sailing to Titop island for trekking and taking photos with panoramic view of the day.

Have chance to enjoy traditional music performed by Champa girls in their colorful uniforms.
Leave My Son for Cao Lau boat station. Take a boat trip on Thu Bon River. Experience the lifestyle of local people and enjoy fresh air.
Have lunch on the boat before stopping at Kim Bong Carpentry Village – The traditional country village.

Come back hotel, free time until deaprture time.

timeline.title: Day 7: Ho Chi Minh city- Cu Chi tunnels tour (meals B/L)
timeline.description:
Time: start 8.00 – return 19.00
Itinerary:
We start the trip by visiting Reunification Palace, whose former name was Norodom Palace. Ngo Viet Thu is exactly the architect who designed this stunning palace. Later, other next destinations consist of Notre Dame Cathedral, Central Post Office, and especially War Remnants Museum, where exhibits on Vietnam War and Indochina Wars are displayed. After enjoying lunch at the local restaurant, you will be taken to Cu Chi Tunnels. Before entering allotted areas of Cu Chi Tunnels, watch an introductory video which is an overview of the tunnel system’s history and Vietnamese’s life during the hard time of war. 
Climb down small tunnels to get amazing experiences and blow your mind when special constructed living areas and martial facilities of Viet Cong appear in front of your eyes. It will be great to know the system of tunnels – a subterranean village where there are bedrooms, kitchens, field hospitals, command centers, weapons factories, and storage. Moreover, taste special tea and cassava – the common food of Vietnamese guerillas in the past. Take your break time to try the real shooting gun or just relax as you wish. 
Return to Saigon and end the trip. 
Please take notes: the Notre Dame Cathedral have been being restored (UNTIL 2022), so the guests just visit outside.
Overnight in Ho Chi Minh.

timeline.description:
A smooth one-and-half-hour bus ride through rice field scenery along National Highway 1 brings you to the beautiful rural district of Trung Luong.
On arrival at My Tho, after visiting Vinh Trang pagoda, take a motor boat to enter My Tho city through Bao Dinh natural canal. Take a leisurely cruise on the Tien River to view the four beautiful islands known as Dragon, Unicorn, Phoenix and Tortoise islands.
Enjoy lunch at the local restaurant, then visit the coconut candy mill and take an amazing rowing boat trip along the small canal on a hand-rowed sampan under the shadow of the water coconut trees along natural canals. Then enjoy seasonal fruit & honey tea to the sound of "Southern Vietnamese folk music", performed by locals.
Meet at the bus and return to Ho Chi Minh City. This trip provides a fascinating insight into daily life in the Mekong Delta and you are guaranteed to take home your own private collection of beautiful memories.
Free time in the evening.
